problem.markdown:
1. Calculate the mean of the following data.
0.9501, 0.2311, 0.6068, 0.4860, 0.8913, 0.7621, 0.4565, 0.0185, 0.8214, 0.4447 (x) 0.5669 () 0.6669 () 0.4669 () 0.5649
2. What is the variance of the above data? (x) 0.8930 () 0.0983 () 0.0893 () 0.7813
3. Suppose that within a very large corporation salaries are positively skewed with a mean of $40,000 and a standard deviation of $20,000. Which statement is true for a sample of workers?
() At least 68.3 percent of workers have a salary between $20,000 and $60,000 () At least 75.0 percent of workers have a salary between $20,000 and $60,000 () At least 88.9 percent of workers have a salary below $100,000 () At least 95.4 percent of workers have a salary below $100,000 (x) Don't know
problem.p: 1. Calculate the mean of the following data.
2. What is the variance of the above data?
3. Suppose that within a very large corporation salaries are positively skewed with a mean of $40,000 and a standard deviation of $20,000. Which statement is true for a sample of workers?

choicegroup.choice: At least 68.3 percent of workers have a salary between $20,000 and $60,000
At least 75.0 percent of workers have a salary between $20,000 and $60,000
At least 88.9 percent of workers have a salary below $100,000
At least 95.4 percent of workers have a salary below $100,000
